intro: Stenogyne ohiascandens, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Stenogyne ohiascandens plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
